p: Sitoindosides VII and VIII (50â€“100 mg/kg) showed a significant anti-stress effect in forced swimming induced immobility and gastric ulcers in mice ( 230). The alcoholic whole plant extract when orally administered (100 mg/kg of body weight) twice a day reduced stress-induced elevation in blood urea level, blood lactic acid, and adrenal hypertrophy in rats ( 231). The extract improved the swimming duration of mice with restoration of plasma cortisol, blood glucose, and triglyceride levels ( 232). The role of the plant for synergistic activation of the differential gamma-aminobutyric acid receptor as a potential pathway for the adaptogenic and neurological disorders (anxiety, nervous exhaustion, insomnia, etc.) in mice was investigated and found to be prominent ( 233).
